refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Mvchpf is an digital implementation of the 4th-order (24 dB/oct) Moog high-pass filter, originally written by Fons Andriaensen. According to the author, mvchpf "...is based on the voltage controlled highpass filter by Robert Moog. again with some attention to the nonlinear effects."

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: asig mvchpf ain, kcf, kres[, istor]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: istor --initial disposition of internal data space. Since filtering incorporates a feedback loop of previous output, the initial status of the storage space used is significant. A zero value will clear the space; a non-zero value will allow previous information to remain. The default value is 0.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kcf/acf -- filter cutoff frequency. The useful range is around six octaves below and above middle C (pch 8.00).
kres/ares -- resonance, limited to the interval [0,1].
